skill.name: hmdb-database
skill.description: Access Human Metabolome Database (220K+ metabolites). Search by name/ID/structure, retrieve chemical properties, biomarker data, NMR/MS spectra, pathways, for metabolomics and identification.
skill.summary: Access Human Metabolome Database (220K+ metabolites). Search by name/ID/structure, retrieve chemical...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.
skill.license: HMDB is offered to the public as a freely available resource. Use and re-distribution of the data, in whole or in part, for commercial purposes requires explicit permission of the authors and explicit acknowledgment of the source material (HMDB) and the original publication (see the HMDB citing page). We ask that users who download significant portions of the database cite the HMDB paper in any resulting publications.

security_audit.summary: No executable code or network tooling is present. The content is documentation about HMDB usage and data fields. No data theft or malicious execution patterns found.

content.user_title: Explore HMDB data and search options
content.value_statement: Finding trusted metabolite data can be slow and confusing. This skill explains HMDB searches, fields, and downloads so you can work faster.
actual_capabilities: Explain HMDB text, structure, and spectral search options
Describe HMDB metabolite data fields and categories
Summarize downloadable HMDB formats and uses
Outline programmatic access options and contacts
limitations: Does not provide a public HMDB API or live queries
Cannot bypass HMDB access permissions or licensing
Does not supply raw HMDB datasets

use_cases.title: Plan metabolite identification
use_cases.description: Choose HMDB searches and fields for MS or NMR matching.

use_cases.title: Review biomarker context
use_cases.description: Find which HMDB fields support disease association checks.

use_cases.title: Design data ingestion
use_cases.description: Select HMDB download formats and field mappings for pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Find a metabolite
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to search HMDB for a metabolite by name and HMDB ID, and list the key fields to review.

prompt_templates.title: Check biomarker data
prompt_templates.prompt: Which HMDB fields show biomarker status, disease links, and concentration ranges for a metabolite?

prompt_templates.title: Plan bulk download
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare HMDB XML, SDF, and CSV downloads and recommend which format fits structural analysis and tabular reporting.

prompt_templates.title: Design a pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a pipeline to parse HMDB XML and map external IDs to KEGG, PubChem, and ChEBI.

output_examples.input: Summarize the HMDB fields I should use for pathway analysis.
output: Use pathways, protein_associations, and reactions fields for pathway context.
Map SMPDB and KEGG IDs to link external pathway resources.
Capture enzymes and transporters to connect metabolites to reactions.

best_practices: Track the HMDB version used in your analysis
Use multiple evidence types for metabolite identification
Prefer official downloads for large scale work
anti_patterns: Relying on a single evidence type for identification

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance is plain text and works across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not access HMDB directly or provide datasets, and it cannot grant API access.

faq.question: How can I integrate HMDB data into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Download XML or CSV files and map fields like accession, pathways, and external IDs.

faq.question: Does it access my files or send data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides guidance and does not read files or call external services.

faq.question: What should I do if a field is missing in HMDB?
faq.answer: Check field completeness notes and consider alternate fields or updated HMDB versions.

faq.question: How does this compare to DrugBank or SMPDB?
faq.answer: HMDB focuses on human metabolites, while DrugBank is drug centric and SMPDB focuses on pathway maps.
